Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2012 02:55PM ILBoysMom wrote: My advice would be to find someone else - now - before you have too much time invested in this doc.  My BS is a real piece of work, and I wish I would have said something sooner.  You will be seeing this person for the next 5 years minimum, so you need to be comfortable.  When my BS made me wait, in waiting room rattan chairs, for almost 3 hours seven days after my BMX I should have walked out the door.  The average wait time to see her now is between 2-3 hours each appointment.  They say that she is "running late today".  Well, then I should get $$$ off my bill to put towards the extra hours that I am paying a sitter!!!!!
Posts.Title: Feeling so upset at doctor liveit56 liveit56

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2012 12:34PM ILBoysMom wrote: Trust me, most people won't even notice.  Try it in a less sensitive location the first few times like the grocery store, shopping, etc.  The first time I went anywhere or saw anyone I was absolutely overcome with anxiety.  Now, at almost 20 weeks PFC, I went topless for the first time a week ago.  Believe it or not, I had the same anxiety all over again.  I know some women take an ativan or xanax to help.
Posts.Title: Why am I so ashamed of my hair loss? JoanQuilts DivineMrsM

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2012 03:00PM ILBoysMom wrote: Speaking of hair, so glad mine is starting to grow but once it started it doesn't seem to be growing fast enough.  HOWEVER, the hair on my face is going crazy.  Is it the Tamoxifen or the post chemo effects?  I was on Taxotere and Carboplatin along with Herceptin.  The fuzz is everywhere and getting worse by the day.  Anyone else????  It's like a cruel joke!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2012 02:40PM ILBoysMom wrote: My hair used to be a medium auburn, and now at 15 PFC it is all black and white.  I went to see my hairdresser this week, and she calls this "chemo charcoal".  She is the area instructor for Look Good Feel Better and has a lot of experience in helping ladies after chemo.  She would not color mine until I have an inch of hair as the color will have to process so long to fully take.  She told me to come back in 4 weeks.  She said that I still had enough scalp showing through in the crown area that if she colored it I would like like somone colored my head with a marker.  Not the look I was going for, so try again later . . . .
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2012 10:13AM ILBoysMom wrote: Thanks for all of your encouragement.  I am going today after lunch to get the color, and get the hair over my ears and on my neck cleaned up a bit.  I am just going to go for it.  I figure that it has to be a lot less shocking to see me with very short hair than it was to see me for the first time when it all came out hiding under a hat.   It seems like every little thing, like this, gives me such anxiety anymore.  I just have to do it and get it over with!  I will try to post a pic later.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2012 11:04AM ILBoysMom wrote: This hair thing is exhausting me.  Like many of you, I am 14 weeks PFC.  I am at about the same growth stage as Kiwi.  On other threads so many people are so stressed about the appearance of their new boobs, but me, I would rather have hair than boobs any day!!!  We are in the midst of a blizzard here in IL today, so I guess my hats are going to come in handy for a while. When did most of you go in for a trim or shaping the first time?   I mentioned it to my husband that I might want to get the hair over my ears and on the back of my neck trimmed up, and he looked at me like I was crazy.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2012 07:29PM ILBoysMom wrote: Wendyspet, you have inspired me to call my hairdresser tomorrow.  I am at the same stage, and I think I am ready to move on.  My hair has come in black and white - crazy since I was a medium auburn before.  I think that if it was back to a "normal" color, it would give me the boost I need to try going topless for the first time. Thanks for your post!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2012 02:09PM ILBoysMom wrote: Anybody have any advice for going "topless" the first time?  I am so excited that I am finally going to get my gray/black chemo hair dyed tomorrow at 16 weeks PFC.  However, I am very anxious about this change.  Suggestions or experiences anyone want to share?
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2012 06:41AM ILBoysMom wrote: For me it was at about 6 weeks.  Unfortunately, that's when I went in to have my power port placed and started chemo the next week.  This is tough stuff, and the docs don't give you a break as the cancer doesn't have a lot of patience for us to feel better in this process.  I am now 12 weeks past my last chemo, and I feel pretty normal - or at least as normal as BC treatment allows.  The docs say it's gone, but it's still there in my thoughts.  I don't know when that goes away. . . .  If I had enough hair to get rid of these hats, I would feel much more so.
Posts.Title: When do you start feeling normal? Cats134 Hindsfeet

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2012 05:58PM ILBoysMom wrote: Wow, that is powerful.  I am very anxious to see this.  I have to admit I start to sweat, almost feel suffocated, by all this pink business at times.  It makes it cool, and it's just not cool.
Posts.Title: Pink Ribbon Inc. film. Exposing truths behind the pinkness. ango74 Laurie08

Posts.Content: May 7, 2012 09:27AM ILBoysMom wrote: During my MRI, I had a cold and I absentmindedly sniffed my nose (as it was dripping, literally, off my face onto the table).  They caught it in time, and they were able to retake that shot.  All it takes is the smallest of movements, and it ruins the image.  I would guess that is the case.  However, you very well might want to clarify in case it becomes an issue with your insurance provider.
Posts.Title: why would they repeat a breast mri 3 days later? cathferra Neeners815

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2012 03:02PM ILBoysMom wrote: I understand your frustration.  Both of my tumors were never found on a mammogram - one not even on ultrasound,only on the MRI.  Now I have an area on my "good" side that is concerning me that I found last week.  I have an appointment with my PS next Tuesday, and I am waiting to see him as I feel two nodules that are near the incisions from my lift.  Is it scar tissue?  I hope, but they are definitely there.  I had the lift during nipple recon in Dec.  To me with all this potential unknown, I don't know why these docs just don't send us in straight for ultrasound and if necessary, an MRI, rather than going through the time and cost of a mammogram - especially when you only have one good breast left and a history of dense tissue.  Seems like a waste of time, worry, and insurance $$$.
Posts.Title: Freaking out - questionable nodularity Shanagirl jennyboog
